title: Active@ File Recovery Ultimate 15.0.5 + Key
description:
Active@ File Recovery Ultimate 15.0.5 + Serial

Release date: 04/03/2016

Efficient & easy to use recovery utility for deleted, damaged or lost files, even if your PC doesn't boot.

In addition to Active@ File Recovery Professional features, Active@ File Recovery Ultimate installation package contains Active@ Boot Disk Lite - a bootable Windows 8-based ISO Image that you can burn to CD/DVD/Blu-ray or write to USB Flash Disk using supplied Bootable Disk Creator.

Windows PE boots from this CD/DVD/USB and you are able to recover partitions and particular files and folders from the lightweight Windows recovery environment.
This is crucial for unbootable systems.
Starting from v. 13 Ultimate package includes Linux-based bootable Active@ LiveCD and Active@ Boot Disk, being able to boot all the latest x86 & x64 UEFI secure boot systems.

New in version 15

- More pre-defined file signatures recognition: AC3, MSG, 3DS, MAX, DXF, CMX, AMV, 4XM, 4XA, EPS, XZ, LZ4, BZ2, JP2, M2V, MTS, FDB
- Added file system's metadata display: $FILE & $INDX file records for NTFS, $DIR Directory entries for FAT/FAT32
- Added support for Linux/Unix XFS file system scan & data recovery
- Added support for Linux Logical Volume Manager (LVM) partitioning and recovery
- Improved Windows Logical Disk Manager (LDM) support for nested volumes
- Improved display for HiDPI monitors and large resolution screens
- Improvements in user interface and in data recovery algorithms
- Ultimate package: the latest Active@ Boot Disk and improved Boot Disk Creator
- Ultimate package: the latest Active@ LiveCD (64-bit) with updated drivers and new utilities

When to use

- Recover deleted files after Recycle Bin has been emptied, or files were deleted while bypassing the Recycle Bin (ex. large files)
- Recover files lost due to accidental disk formatting, damage by virus attack, malicious program, or a power failure
- Recover photos & pictures deleted from a USB Flash, or images lost after formatting a Memory Card (SD, CompactFlash)
- Data restoring when partition or volume is deleted, damaged or formatted, or disk has bad sectors

How to use

- Recover deleted or lost files via QuickScan and Search
- Recover damaged partitions and disks using SuperScan
- Recover unbootable PC using Active@ Boot Disk Lite
- 
Homepage http://www.file-recovery.com/
